thread.title: Longhorns win ‘nasty’ against Kansas State
thread.title_full: Longhorns win ‘nasty’ against Kansas State - San Antonio Express-News

author: Mike Finger
title: Longhorns win ‘nasty’ against Kansas State
text:
Photo: Tom Reel / San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Longhorn running back D'Onta Foreman busts through the line for a gain in the first half as UT hosts Kansas State at DKR Stadium on October 24, 2015. Longhorn running back D'Onta Foreman busts through the line for a gain in the first half as UT hosts Kansas State at DKR Stadium on October 24, 2015. Photo: Tom Reel / San Antonio Express-News Longhorns win ‘nasty’ against Kansas State 1 / 1 Back to Gallery AUSTIN — Per the NCAA rule book, a regulation football must weigh between 14 and 15 ounces. But as a downpour at Royal-Memorial Stadium raged on Saturday morning, Texas quarterback Jerrod Heard estimated the waterlogged hunk of leather in his hands felt five times heavier.
At one point, midway through the second quarter, Heard’s head coach asked him about the possibility of throwing a forward pass.
“I was kind of really scared,” Heard said. “I was like, ‘We can try, but I’d just be palming it and tossing it up.’”
As it turned out, the Longhorns had much better options. Choosing to keep the ball out of the air and entrusting it to their rugged running game, they pummeled their way to a 23-9 victory over Kansas State.
For more, visit ExpressNews.com
